title: Timeline Inner - Usage Examples
description: Child timeline item block. Alternative to RContent array in parent tp-timeline. Each timeline item is a separate block for easier management.

childBlocks: Add nested content blocks as children of tp-timeline-inner:
Child blocks appear INSIDE timeline item card
examples.useCase: Complex timelines with rich content, feature showcases, detailed specifications, multi-section items
notes: IMPORTANT: Child blocks render INSIDE timeline item (below description)
Don't use description attribute if you want full control with child blocks
Use child blocks for complex formatting: lists, images, tables, buttons
Keep child block count reasonable (3-5 max per item for performance)
Test on mobile (child blocks stack vertically in timeline item)
This is the main advantage over RContent array (can't add child blocks to array items)

attrs.description: Started with a vision to change the industry
Launched flagship product that revolutionized the market
Opened offices in 15 countries, reached 1M customers
Launched AI-powered features transforming user experience

examples.useCase: Any timeline requiring easy management of individual items, or rich content per item (nested blocks)
notes: Parent tp-timeline defines overall style, alignment, start/end pins
Each tp-timeline-inner child defines one timeline item
index must be sequential: 0, 1, 2, 3...
repetKey should be unique for each item
RPosition alternates (right, left, right, left) for zigzag with parent Alignment='center'
This approach is easier to manage than RContent array (each item is a separate block)
Allows nested child blocks inside each timeline item (not possible with RContent array)
Best for 5-15 timeline items (more items = use RContent array for better performance)

tpTimelineRContentArray.description: Parent tp-timeline with RContent array attribute
advantages: All timeline items defined in one place (parent attributes)
Better performance for many items (single block, not multiple)
limitations: Can't add child blocks inside timeline items (text/HTML only)
Harder to edit individual items (need to find in array)
Limited to predefined fields (RTitle, RcTitle, Rdes, etc.)
tpTimelineRContentArray.bestFor: Simple timelines with text content, 10+ items, no nested blocks needed

tpTimelineInnerChildBlocks.description: Parent tp-timeline with tp-timeline-inner child blocks
advantages: Each timeline item is a separate block (easier to manage)
Can add nested child blocks inside each item (headings, images, lists, buttons)
Visual editing in block editor (drag/drop items)
Easier to reorder items (block editor UI)
Can mix different content types per item
limitations: More blocks = slightly slower performance (5-15 items recommended)
Each item is separate entity (harder to duplicate entire timeline)
tpTimelineInnerChildBlocks.bestFor: Rich content timelines, nested blocks needed, visual editing, 5-15 items

indexing.description: index attribute must start at 0 and increment sequentially
indexing.important: Don't skip numbers, don't use negatives, don't duplicate

repetKey.description: Unique identifier for each timeline item
repetKey.important: Must be unique across all timeline-inner blocks in same parent

pinTypes.text: Rnone='text' + custom text label (not commonly used in child blocks)

validationRules.parentRequired: CRITICAL: Must be child of tpgb/tp-timeline block (won't work standalone)
validationRules.index: Required, must be number starting at 0, sequential (0, 1, 2, 3...)
validationRules.repetKey: Required, must be unique string identifier
validationRules.RcTitle: Optional, main heading for timeline item
validationRules.description: Optional, description text (omit if using only child blocks)
validationRules.Ricon: Required when Rnone='icon', must be valid FontAwesome class
validationRules.style: Inherited from parent tp-timeline, don't set on child
validationRules.layout: Inherited from parent tp-timeline, don't set on child
validationRules.PinStyle: Optional, pin visual style (usually inherited from parent)

warnings: CRITICAL: tp-timeline-inner MUST be child of tpgb/tp-timeline (won't render standalone)
CRITICAL: Don't set style or layout on tp-timeline-inner (inherited from parent)
CRITICAL: index must be sequential starting at 0 (gaps cause rendering issues)
CRITICAL: repetKey must be unique (duplicates cause item conflicts)
Don't use both description attribute AND child blocks (choose one approach)
Rnone='icon' requires Ricon with valid FontAwesome class
Rnone='image' requires tp-image child block (not Rimg attribute like RContent array)
RButton=true requires RBtnText (button styling comes from parent)
Max 15 child timeline-inner blocks recommended (use RContent array for more items)
Each timeline-inner adds DOM elements (impacts performance vs RContent array)
Parent timeline controls overall styling (start/end pins, alignment, animations)
Don't mix RContent array and child timeline-inner blocks in same parent (use one approach)
RPosition must coordinate with parent Alignment (right/left/center zigzag pattern)
Child blocks inside timeline-inner appear BELOW description text
Heavy nested content in child blocks can impact mobile performance
commonMistakes: Forgetting that tp-timeline-inner requires parent tp-timeline
Using number for index instead of starting at 0
Using duplicate repetKey values (causes item conflicts)
Setting style on child instead of parent (style is inherited)
Using Rnone='image' with Rimg attribute (should use tp-image child block instead)
Not alternating RPosition with parent Alignment='center' (loses zigzag)
Adding 20+ timeline-inner blocks (use RContent array for many items)
Using Rnone='icon' without Ricon attribute (pin appears broken)
Mixing description text with rich child blocks (confusing content flow)
Trying to use timeline-inner without parent timeline
Using invalid FontAwesome class in Ricon (icon doesn't display)
Not coordinating RPosition pattern with parent Alignment setting
bestPractices: Always use sequential index starting at 0: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4...
Coordinate RPosition with parent Alignment for desired layout (zigzag vs one-sided)
For zigzag: parent Alignment='center' + alternate child RPosition (right, left, right, left)
For one-sided: parent Alignment='left' + all children RPosition='right'
Choose timeline-inner child blocks when you need nested content (headings, images, lists)
Choose RContent array when you have simple text items or 10+ items
Use Rnone='icon' with matching content-appropriate icons (fas fa-rocket, fas fa-star)
Use Rnone='none' for minimal designs (just dots, no decorative icons)
Keep description concise (1-2 sentences) if using child blocks for main content
Limit to 5-15 timeline-inner blocks per parent for optimal performance
Test on mobile (child blocks stack vertically inside timeline item)
Use RButton=true + RBtnText for CTAs in timeline items
Don't duplicate parent settings on child (style, layout, Alignment are inherited)
Use unique block_id for each timeline-inner block
When using Rnone='image', add tp-image child block as first child (renders as pin)
For career timelines: use company logos as image pins (100x100px square)
For process steps: use sequential RTitle ('Step 1', 'Step 2') with Rnone='icon'
For events: use time in RTitle ('9:00 AM') with session icons
accessibilityNotes: Use semantic heading hierarchy (RcTitle should match parent context level)
Ensure sufficient color contrast (inherited from parent timeline styling)
Provide meaningful RTitle and RcTitle values (screen readers announce these)
Use descriptive RBtnText for buttons ('Learn More About Product', not 'Click Here')
Don't rely solely on icons to convey information (use RTitle + RcTitle + description)
Ensure timeline is keyboard navigable (buttons/links have focus states)
Test with screen readers (items announced in chronological order)
Use proper heading levels in child blocks (h3, h4, not h1)
Avoid text over backgrounds without sufficient contrast
Ensure touch targets are at least 44x44px on mobile (buttons, links)
For image pins: provide alt text in tp-image child block
Don't auto-play media in child blocks (user-controlled only)
Provide clear visual indication of timeline progression (parent controls line/pins)
Test on mobile screen readers (VoiceOver iOS, TalkBack Android)
performanceConsiderations: Limit to 5-15 timeline-inner blocks per parent (more = use RContent array)
Each child block adds DOM elements (vs RContent array = lighter)
Optimize images in child blocks (WebP format, compressed, lazy loading)
Avoid heavy child blocks (large iframes, auto-play videos)
For 10+ items: prefer RContent array (better performance than many child blocks)
Test on mobile devices (multiple child blocks can slow rendering)
Keep nested child blocks to 3-5 per timeline-inner item
Use Rnone='none' for minimal design (faster than loading icon fonts)
Lazy load images in tp-image child blocks (WordPress default)
Monitor Cumulative Layout Shift (CLS) when timeline loads
Test with slow 3G connection (Chrome DevTools throttling)
Consider pagination for very long timelines (split into sections)
Avoid embedding external content in child blocks (heavy on resources)

fromRContentToChildBlocks.description: How to convert tp-timeline RContent array to tp-timeline-inner child blocks
steps: 1. Create parent tp-timeline block (same as before, remove RContent array)
2. For each item in RContent array, create one tp-timeline-inner child block
3. Map RContent[0] → tp-timeline-inner with index=0, RContent[1] → index=1, etc.
4. Copy _key from RContent to repetKey in timeline-inner
5. Copy RTitle, RcTitle, Rdes, RPosition, Rnone, Ricon from RContent to timeline-inner
6. If RContent had RButton, copy to timeline-inner RButton + RBtnText
7. If RContent had Rfimage, add tp-image child block inside timeline-inner
8. If RContent had RcHTML, replace with nested child blocks (tp-heading, tp-paragraph, etc.)
